Package com.cosmicraiders

Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
com.cosmicraiders.GameScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
public class GameScreen extends Object implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
Includes the main game logic as well as most GUI elements of the game. Includes game avatars, background, movement, shooting, collision, and more.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameScreen(CosmicRaiders game)
    using the constructor instead of the create() method this builds a GameScreen instance using the Game instance it uses an auxiliary method called initialize() to construct objects

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScreen

      public GameScreen(CosmicRaiders game)
      using the constructor instead of the create() method this builds a GameScreen instance using the Game instance it uses an auxiliary method called initialize() to construct objects
      Parameters:
      game - ; the Game instance, here: CosmicRaiders

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This auxiliary method constructs objects needed for the game. It is called each time a new round starts. It builds NEW arrays and new auxiliary objects like Painter and Spawner. The old arrays and objects from the last round are not emptied, they are de-referenced and removed by the garbage collector.

    • checkGameOver

      public void checkGameOver()
      Is called when the game is over because the figher was destroyed. Is called by the destroyFighter() method in CollisionHandler.

    • render

      public void render(float delta)
      Includes the main game logic as well as most GUI elements of the game. Includes game avatars, background, movement, shooting, collision, and more. LibGDX tutorial recommends not creating objects here - this method is called many times per second.
      Specified by:
      render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
      Parameters:
      delta - The time in seconds since the last render.

    • show

      public void show()
      start the playback of the background music when the screen is shown
      Specified by:
      show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
